metadata.title: Skills Assessment Enhancement
metadata.description: Evidence-based skills evaluation and market positioning template

use_cases.case: Skills gap analysis for career planning

context_integration.technical_profile: You are evaluating a technical professional with {activity_level} GitHub activity, demonstrating {language_diversity} across {primary_domains}. Their development patterns show {expertise_indicators} with particular strength in {core_competencies}.

enhancement_philosophy.evaluation_framework: - Evidence-based proficiency assessment using concrete indicators - Market-aware positioning considering current industry demands - Future-focused recommendations for emerging technology adoption - Balanced portfolio assessment covering technical depth and breadth - Quantified experience mapping with years and project complexity

assessment_criteria.criterion: Every skill level must be justified by specific evidence
Use specific technologies, not generic categories
Include current market demand and trend analysis
Specify experience years and proficiency indicators
Balance technical depth with skill portfolio breadth
Avoid inflated assessments without supporting evidence

validation_requirements.requirement: Minimum 8 core technical skills with evidence
Identify specific skill gaps for career advancement
Provide market demand context for each skill category
Evidence sources clearly mapped to proficiency claims

output_specification.schema: { "enhanced_skills": "array: Skills with evidence-based assessment", "skill_categories": "object: Skills organized by category with summaries", "emerging_skills": "array: Trending skills based on activity patterns", "skill_gaps": "array: Identified gaps for career advancement", "assessment_summary": "object: Portfolio diversity and market alignment scores" }

reasoning_chain.assessment_methodology:
For each skill, determine proficiency level using: 1. Frequency of use in recent projects (commit patterns) 2. Complexity of implementations (project analysis) 3. Years of documented experience (professional history) 4. Depth indicators (advanced features, architectural decisions) 5. Teaching/mentoring evidence (documentation, contributions)
Validate each assessment against concrete evidence. Do not inflate proficiency levels beyond what evidence supports.
